wikipedia_page.main: Muriel Dickson (12 July 1903 – 11 March 1990) was a Scottish soprano who was particularly known for her performances in the works of Gilbert and Sullivan.  After performing with the D'Oyly Carte Opera Company for seven years, she sang for four seasons with the Metropolitan Opera and went on to a concert career.  In later years, she taught singing at the Royal Scottish Academy of Music and Drama and privately.
